channel.title: frankm tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from frankm.

item.description: I just earned the '2X (Level 7)' badge on @untappd! https://t.co/FOTI5UlOci
Last year nearly all of the flowering trees near us were blooming but this year most only have buds. However, the first tree to normally bloom has started but has a way to go. https://t.co/SjoMXB6QH4

Unlike Axios, I don‚Äôt think Musk‚Äôs desire for Twitter is as a tech mogul, instead his is simply wearing his billionaire hat. I think the wealthy like Musk are concerned about the negative reputation toward and potential cancel culture of the wealthy. ... https://t.co/MoSlL4PwTU
Setting Up A New iPad: https://t.co/319VVqCeXV

If Musk wanted to impress me he would get rid of Twitter‚Äôs algorithm completely and revert Twitter to a reverse chronological feed, citing how the algorithm is nothing more than feeding an addiction. We don‚Äôt need to see the algorithm, we need to get ... https://t.co/dvJ9DUYQj5
Day 1 of my long birthday weekend, aka retirement practice, has begun. I wish we were not experiencing below normal temperature that is made worse by above normal wind.

An authoritarin often claims to be the sole person who can make someone or something successful. Private ownership of Twitter by Musk has nothing to really do with democracy. His past record has done nothing for me to trust him.

Like many other Android users, when DarkSky for Android went away I moved to AccuWeather. AccuWeather has had a temperature indicator in its persistent notification that recently became just a dot and I‚Äôve learned is that because they now put that ... https://t.co/SW1z0Nm1nL
Good news. A nasal spray in development to treat COVID is proving to be effective. The ideal of administering nasal spray to mice causes me to chuckle. https://t.co/D1R6Rj1hi3

Musk is now trying to buy Twitter. Imagine he owns Twitter and then runs for President of the United States. Would be forced to divest? A precident was set with Trump. If the sale proceeds there should be conditions that if he were to run for office ... https://t.co/Ql4dWlNRsg

I‚Äôve read Jonathan Haidt‚Äôs essay, Why the Past 10 Years of American Life Have Been Uniquely Stupid. I can summarize Haidt by saying the algorithms in social media are destroying our democratic society. We have devolved in to the very things that James ... https://t.co/jwBTMHeKWd

Yesterday I thought about what abstraction exists that can enable one to use the editor of their choice to publish to a web site and concluded git and text/markdown provide that today. We just need ‚Äúgeneral purpose‚Äù editors (read not IDEs) to ... https://t.co/FBeVisaBag

I am enjoying watching Detroit sports learn how great a player Javier Baez is, as a Cubs fan I appreciate his unique talent and was disappointed the Cubs didn‚Äôt sign him. I remember a time when shortstops were considered the worst batter in the ... https://t.co/7Oxe9gRJyx

Currently reading: The Last Week - What the Gospels Really Teach About Jesus‚Äôs Final Days in Jerusalem by Marcus J. Borg üìö I‚Äôve read this book a few times during Holy Week and doing it again this year. https://t.co/4lV8n41Gtc
It is only the second game, but I am already liking this Cubs lineup. Three runs on one hit is not something we saw much since 2016.

RSS is the main way that I gather what I read online and I have been using it for a couple of decades. Not much has changed in how RSS readers (aggregators) work but today I found something intriguing that I would like to have. https://t.co/VjFHWxlUnO
@davewiner I am curious, having read your post about Apple and networking, what your opinion was of HyperCard? I know it inspired Ward to write wiki.
